intro: Cynoglossum clandestinum var. fallax, commonly known as the autumn bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are lanceolate, with a slightly hairy surface, and the plant thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and rocky areas, preferring partial to full sun.
